customer_reviews.title: Best polish for chrome!
customer_reviews.text: It is unfortunate that people out of incompetence, ignorance, or misuse, rate a product low without much regard to its true merits. Like most products, this one has applications in which it excels and other for which it is inappropriate. It is not a heavy polishing compound (i.e. not very abrasive) so it will have limitations as to how fast it can abrade "...30 years worth of old junk"-- it is not intended for that. As far as cleaning and polishing chrome, it is about the best I have ever used. Apply, rub right away (before it dries), remove and buff.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. X

customer_reviews.title: Whip out the gas mask.
customer_reviews.text: Here's the deal, it does indeed work. That said, the ammonia in this is so damn strong "well ventilated area" doesn't even begin to cut it. You don't use this in the garage with the door open. You take your work table out into the driveway. It's that strong, and no, I'm not kidding. Will it help revive old brass? youbetcha. (But you're going to put in plenty of sweat equity and ruin a plethora of rags.) Will you ever be able to use this in the house? Not unless you feel like inviting the grim reaper over for a nice cuppa tea poured from grandma's (now) shiny teapot.
customer_reviews.author: Romanos

customer_reviews.title: Stinky and nasty -- good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My entire purpose in acquiring this polish was for firearms. I wanted to make shiny ramps, chambers, bushings, etc. Well, bunkie, this stuff certainly works to that end. Work it into a buffing wheel or cone and buff away. This stuff works great and doesn't get slung off at high rotational speeds like automotive buffing compound. Flitz is a little more abrasive than this stuff. Auto buffing compound is less so. But Blue Magic provides a simple and effective means of cleaning metal and removing fine machining marks, et al, until you end up with a perfectly smooth surface. The only way to make it any shinier would be to use electro-polishing.
customer_reviews.author: Some Useless Geek
